properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall amounts of 15 to 20 centimetres are expected over these regions tonight. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-31T11:59:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-31T03:55:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4209782055.2020
Area: Saint-Michel-des-Saints area, Saint-Donat - Mont-Tremblant Park area, Mont-Tremblant - Sainte-Agathe area, Sainte-Adèle - Saint-Sauveur area, Saint-Jérôme area, Lachute area, Berthierville - Saint-Gabriel area, Rawdon - Joliette area, Mascouche area, Louiseville area, Matawin - Mauricie National Park area, Lac-aux-Sables area, Shawinigan area, Sainte-Anne-de-la-Pérade area, Trois-Rivières area, Portneuf area, Valcartier - Stoneham area, Québec area, Côte-de-Beaupré - L'Île d'Orléans area, Bellechasse area, Lévis area, Saint-Lambert area, Lotbinière area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 15 cm is expected. Snow has moved into the region and will persist until this evening. Conditions are expected to improve this evening. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-31T13:59:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-30T23:49:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3615553151.2020
Area: Elliot Lake - Ranger Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall accumulations exceeding 15 cm are likely over these areas on Saturday. Locations: southern and western Nova Scotia Time span: Saturday and Saturday evening. Remarks: Current indications are that snow will begin in southwestern Nova Scotia early Saturday morning and then spread eastward across the province, reaching eastern areas by afternoon. Along parts of the Atlantic coast, especially in the southwest, rain is expected. Over these areas, snowfall amounts will be much lower than inland areas. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-01T00:44:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-31T08:44:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1047204159.2020
Area: Kings County, Annapolis County, Digby County, Lunenburg County, Queens County, Shelburne County, Yarmouth County, Hants County, Halifax Metro and Halifax County West, Halifax County - east of Porters Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Gusty easterly winds up to 90 km/h will continue to bring blizzard conditions over Grise Fiord this morning. These winds should diminish later this morning and allow the blizzard to end. ### Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-31T16:59:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-31T09:21:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0609431502.2020
Area: Grise Fiord
properties.Author: Environment Canada
